channel.title: Australia new fattest country in the world
channel.description:
Americans still win in obesity.
Not so fat, Australia. A new study funded by the land down under found that 26 percent of Aussies are overweight, prompting one newspaper to breathlessly claim that Australia is now the fattest country in the world - even fatter than the United States, whose citizens, the paper claims, are obese at a rate of only 25 percent. The article from The Age, entitled "Australia wins world heavyweight title," references data from a government funded study called "Australia's Future Fat Bomb." According to a 2007 CDC study, however, 34 percent of Americans are obese, meaning they have a BMI, or Body Mass Index, over 25 (the same metric the Australian study used). To catch up with those Texas-sized numbers, the Aussies will need to put more pounds on down under before they can rightfully claim this dubious title. Might we suggest a blooming onion at the Outback Steakhouse? The vegetarian dish reportedly packs 2210 calories.
http://www.nydailynews.com/news/us_world/2008/06/19/2008-06-19_fat_chance_australia_us_is_still_most_ob.html

@bowserjr2 wrote:

BMI do not care about Lothy’s (I don’t remember any other Aussies) muscles and will call him fat.

Read full topic

item.title: Australia new fattest country in the world
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

I recently broke up with my girlfriend, quit the football team and began playing more games. Because I broke up with my girlfriend, I don’t get out as much and people keep giving me things to ‘make me feel better’, when I honestly don’t care if we did or not. Because I quit the football team(bad grades, too lazy to play anymore lol), I’m not practicing and staying in shape(and I don’t have a fast metabolism, so I can very easily gain weight). And finally, because I’m playing more games, I’m sitting on my ass more hours of the day.

I’ve lost 4lbs. because muscle turns into fat.

Read full topic
item.source: Australia new fattest country in the world
